description: Buildings on a riverbank at left with 2 figures in a boat, one with a long staff, near center; mountains in background; fan remounted as a hanging scroll
text:
This fan painting is signed "Xia Sen" on the earthen bank just below and to the right of the roots of the large tree extending from the left margin of the picture.  Born the son of the famous academy painter, Xia Gui (early 13th century), Xia Sen is generally seen as continuing his fatherâ€™s innovative style. This intimate, focused, view of nature, clearly rendered motifs, direct low-level point-of-view, and evocation of a coherent space are all characteristics of the painting circle of Xia Gui. 
The compositional emphasis of one side of the picture over the other creates pictorial tension and interest. The "side contending" (<I>bianjiao<I>) compositions of Ma Yuan (late 12th -early 13th century) and Xia Gui came to characterize Southern Song academy painting and the device was practiced by a wide variety of contemporary artists.
title: Riverside Retreat
